availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Harrison (Lexington, KY, merchant and druggist)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, merchant and druggist. Maryland native. Married to Margaret B. Harrison. Merchant in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Druggist in Lexington in 1860. Employed Thomas Maynard as a druggist in Lexington in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 119B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 426.
Find A Grave, “Margaret B Harrison (1833-1855)," Memorial #99670564, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99670564/margaret-b-harrison (accessed June 4, 2021).
Find A Grave, “Thomas J Harrison (1811-1875)," Memorial #99670728, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99670728/thomas-j-harrison (accessed June 4, 2021).
